intro: Barbarea erysimoides, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters at the tips of the stems. Its leaves are typically lobed and covered in a fine layer of hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. Barbarea erysimoides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
